==== Rumours of Mubarak's family's departure ====
==== Rumours of Mubarak's family's departure ====
â
[[Gamal Mubarak]], President Hosni Mubarak's sonâwho has been widely tipped as his successorâwas reported by the US-based Arabic website Akhbar al-Arab to have fled to [[London]] with his family on 25 January.<ref name="Beginning of the end">{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/articles/105117/20110126/beginning-of-the-end-for-egypt-s-mubarak-as-son-and-wife-flee.htm|title='Beginning of the end' for Egypt's Mubarak as son and wife flee|accessdate=26 January 2011|date=26 January 2011|publisher=[[International Business Times]]}}</ref> Later reports said that Mubarak's family did not, in fact, flee.<ref>{{cite web|last=Norman |first=Joshua |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503543_162-20029614-503543.html |title=Source: Mubarak Family Hasn't Fled Egypt - World Watch |publisher=CBS News |date= |accessdate=2011-01-26}}</ref> Al Jazeera's reporter in Cairo said that Gamal remained in Cairo and was attending a meeting of the ruling National Democratic Party.<ref name="aljazeera-448"/> On Saturday 29th it was reported that Gamal and Alaa Mubbarak had arrived in London with their respective families.<ref>[http://twitter.com/#!/BBCWorld/status/31381280729862144] BBC World Twitter Feed</ref><!-- Yes, this is just a tweet for a ref. please replace with a better ref when one is published --> Egyptian State Television has denied this report.<ref>{{cite web|l|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/9380534.stm|title=Live:Egypt Unrest Day 5|publisher=BBC World News |date= |accessdate=2011-01-29}}</ref><!-- This could also use a less transient source -->
+
[[Gamal Mubarak]], President Hosni Mubarak's sonâwho has been widely tipped as his successorâwas reported by the US-based Arabic website Akhbar al-Arab to have fled to [[London]] with his family on 25 January.<ref name="Beginning of the end">{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/articles/105117/20110126/beginning-of-the-end-for-egypt-s-mubarak-as-son-and-wife-flee.htm|title='Beginning of the end' for Egypt's Mubarak as son and wife flee|accessdate=26 January 2011|date=26 January 2011|publisher=[[International Business Times]]}}</ref> Later reports said that Mubarak's family did not, in fact, flee.<ref>{{cite web|last=Norman |first=Joshua |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503543_162-20029614-503543.html |title=Source: Mubarak Family Hasn't Fled Egypt - World Watch |publisher=CBS News |date= |accessdate=2011-01-26}}</ref> Al Jazeera's reporter in Cairo said that Gamal remained in Cairo and was attending a meeting of the ruling National Democratic Party.<ref name="aljazeera-448"/> On Saturday 29th it was reported that Gamal and [[Alaa Mubbarak]] had arrived in London with their respective families.<ref>[http://twitter.com/#!/BBCWorld/status/31381280729862144] BBC World Twitter Feed</ref><!-- Yes, this is just a tweet for a ref. please replace with a better ref when one is published --> Egyptian State Television has denied this report.<ref>{{cite web|l|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/9380534.stm|title=Live:Egypt Unrest Day 5|publisher=BBC World News |date= |accessdate=2011-01-29}}</ref><!-- This could also use a less transient source -->
